column4: My internet is way slower in Ubuntu than in Windows, (I'm dual-booting) any suggestions?
There are lots of free alternatives to Sony vegas

is anything sucking your RAM?
I doubt it, I have 4 gbs
lucky you. i have 2gb and it's speeding fast already, in fact on my old comp with 512MB it speeds
...but it doesn't use ubuntu, it uses debian, but i'm trying to put ubuntu on it at the moment
i think it has something to do with it getting a conflicting IP or something
that *might* be possible, but unlikely.
also, i didnt have to set anything up for internet in ubuntu, it just fixed itself
that's fine.
my internet was auto-configured by ubuntu and it's fine
I would mess around with the settings but im not sure where to begin
could giving ubuntu its own static ip help?
maybe.
i think windows and ubuntu ARE using different IPs though. are they?
probably
the sad part is the canonical store selling software
yep.
you're right
